Function reference

All functions

Aggregate cells
arrange
Order rows using column values
as_tibble(<SpatialExperiment>)
Coerce lists, matrices, and more to data frames

Efficiently bind multiple data frames by row and column
bind_rows(<SpatialExperiment>)
Efficiently bind multiple data frames by row and column
add_count(<SpatialExperiment>)
Count the observations in each group
distinct
Keep distinct/unique rows
ellipse()
Ellipse Gating Function
extract(<SpatialExperiment>)
Extract a character column into multiple columns using regular expression groups
filter(<SpatialExperiment>)
Keep rows that match a condition
print(<SpatialExperiment>)
Printing tibbles
ggplot
Create a new ggplot from a tidySpatialExperiment
glimpse
Get a glimpse of your data
group_by
Group by one or more variables
inner_join(<SpatialExperiment>)
Mutating joins
join_features
Extract and join information for features.
left_join(<SpatialExperiment>)
Mutating joins
mutate(<SpatialExperiment>)
Create, modify, and delete columns
nest(<SpatialExperiment>)
Nest rows into a list-column of data frames
pivot_longer
Pivot data from wide to long
plot_ly(<SpatialExperiment>)
Initiate a plotly visualization
pull
Extract a single column
rectangle()
Rectangle Gating Function
rename
Rename columns
right_join(<SpatialExperiment>)
Mutating joins
rowwise
Group input by rows
sample_n(<SpatialExperiment>) sample_frac(<SpatialExperiment>)
Sample n rows from a table
select(<SpatialExperiment>)
Keep or drop columns using their names and types
separate(<SpatialExperiment>)
Separate a character column into multiple columns with a regular expression or numeric locations
slice slice_head slice_tail slice_sample slice_min slice_max
Subset rows using their positions
summarise summarize
Summarise each group down to one row
tbl_format_header(<tidySpatialExperiment>)
Format the header of a tibble
unite(<SpatialExperiment>)
Unite multiple columns into one by pasting strings together
unnest(<tidySpatialExperiment_nested>) unnest_single_cell_experiment()
Unnest a list-column of data frames into rows and columns
